answers.answer: It is very early to be concerned with weight gain unless you are gaining or losing a lot.  I was very sick during my first trimester and lost.  I am and little over 16 weeks now and have gained only 1 lb.  Keep up with your Dr appointments and if they become concerned with your weight they will let you know.  This is my 3rd (gained and LOT with my first) but with my second I didn't start putting on any weight at all until 20 weeks and he was very big and came at 41 weeks.  Also, if you are weighing at home do it at the same time every day.  I do in the morning as it seems to be the most consistent.   I weigh more at night lol.
No worries at all im 14 weeks and lost a total of 16lbs due to my diabetes but doc said its ok baby is growing just fine thank god❤

I'm 15 weeks and have lost 10 lbs. But dr said it's perfectly normal. I was having trouble eating after 5pm due to nausea so that's why I lost weight. Plus cutting out soda and coffee. You are fine and so is your baby. Just continue to eat how you normally do and keep taking your prenatals. Try giving ensure a try if your dr wants you to gain weight.
